title: 'Distressed' Alsatian rescued from Helvellyn
article: A "distressed" Alsatian has been rescued from a notorious mountain top in the Lake District. Patterdale Mountain Rescue Team spent about five hours looking for the dog on Striding Edge on the east side of Helvellyn on Friday. The path is popular with walkers but can be dangerous withseveral deaths there in recent years . The dog was passed to the police and its owners are now being sought. His picture has been shared online. Several people said they recognised the dog and have attempted to contact the owners who were, according to one Facebook user, "actively searching for it".
